item.title: सुख (Sukha)
item.description: A few poems on Sukha by Maharishi Shiv Brat Lal Verman
item.dc:creator: Anami
item.content:encoded: All living beings know Dukha (suffering, unhappiness, dissatisfaction) and each living being is searching for Sukha (ease, happiness, satisfaction). In the poems below, Maharishi Shiv points out that the suffering we experience is a kind of cleanse. It forces us to get rid of what is unhelpful or harmful to us. Suffering due to consequences of our ill thoughts and ill actions is only natural. In times of happiness or ease, we forget our true nature and we forget the truth. Dukha or suffering reminds us of the true reality and our true nature. The supreme purpose of our lives is to know our true nature. Maharishi says that Sukha or ease and happiness is the natural outcome of knowing and abiding in one’s true nature.
